# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = []

    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " " * word) <= text_width
            current_line = string(current_line, " ", word)
        else
            push!(lines, lstrip(current_line))
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    # Catch the case where the last line hasn't been pushed yet
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, lstrip(current_line))
    end

    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nunc auctor sapien et libero cursus."
println(wrap_string(str, 10))
```
Output:

```
Lorem 
ipsum 
dolor 
sit 
amet,

```
